reasoning: Age-related cataract measured as prevalence (chronic condition). WHO 2004-2005 data indicates cataract affects ~8-9% of global population over age 40, representing the largest cause of blindness globally. Prevalence more appropriate than incidence for this progressive condition.
source: Pascolini D, Mariotti SP. (2012). Global estimates of visual impairment: 2010. Br J Ophthalmol. 96(5):614-618
